CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Bimolecular recombination was also investigated by measuring the dependence of J sc against light intensity , in which the exponential factor α in the power law of J sc ∝ P light α is used Article to indicate bimolecular recombination in the BHJ film.

Let's think step by step.

Sure! The "Material Name" entities in the paragraph are:

1. BHJ film

The paragraph mentions "BHJ film" as the material being studied, so "BHJ film" is a "Material Name" entity.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

Sure, my apologies. Here are the updated "Material Name" entities in the paragraph:

1. BHJ

The paragraph mentions "BHJ film" and "BHJ" is a commonly used abbreviation for the material, so "BHJ" can be considered a "Material Name" entity.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Sure, here are the valid "Material Name" entities in the paragraph presented in a Markdown table:

| Material Name |
| --- |
| BHJ |
| BHJ film |

Sure! Here are the "Property Name" entities in the given paragraph:

3. α (exponential factor)

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Bimolecular recombination was also investigated by measuring the dependence of J sc against light intensity , in which the exponential factor α in the power law of J sc ∝ P light α is used Article to indicate bimolecular recombination in the BHJ film.

Let's think step by step.

In this paragraph, the "Property Value" entities are:

1. Jsc (recombination current density)
2. Plight (light intensity)
3. α (exponential factor)
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

Sure, here are the entities that refer to the value of a material property:

1. Jsc (recombination current density)
2. α (exponential factor)

These two entities represent the value of the material property of the BHJ film, specifically its recombination current density and the exponent of the power law relationship between recombination current density and light intensity.
